books.title: The Big Bow Mystery
books.author: Israel Zangwill
books.summary: A seemingly impossible murder committed during the trade union movement becomes the obsession of London’s Bow district.

books.title: Bellarion the Fortunate
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: An orphan develops his talents in intrigue, romance, and war in fifteenth-century Italy.

books.title: The Autobiography of Mark Twain
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A collection of reminiscences and reflections from the author’s experiences.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: The Hidden Staircase
books.author: Carolyn Keene
books.summary: A young amateur detective investigates a supposed haunting.

books.title: Twelfth Night
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A woman disguises herself as a man and becomes entangled in the courtship of two aristocrats.

books.title: Candida
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A clergyman’s beliefs about his respectable household are challenged by a young poet who is in love with his wife.

books.title: The Little White Bird
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A series of adventures in London, including those of the narrator and a little boy named David, and Peter Pan.

books.title: An Outback Marriage
books.author: Banjo Paterson
books.summary: A posh Englishwoman is sent to a station in New South Wales to learn the ropes, while a search for a lost son with a large inheritance is underway.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: A Personal Record
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: Conrad recounts his childhood in Poland, his sailing experiences, and the work on his debut novel.

books.title: Scarhaven Keep
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: A famous actor goes missing on the northern English sea coast.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
books.summary: A collection of Ralph Waldo Emerson’s essays.

books.title: Festus
books.author: Philip James Bailey
books.summary: A man goes on a quest for knowledge, truth, and understanding in the face of the complexities of existence and spirituality.

books.title: The Devil’s Dictionary
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A witty, sharp collection of sardonic word definitions from the 1800s and early 1900s that provide a snapshot into the irreverent humor of early American culture.

books.title: Pellucidar
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An adventurer returns to the hollow interior of the Earth in search of his lost love.

books.title: On a Pincushion
books.author: Mary De Morgan
books.summary: The first collection of fairy tales by Mary De Morgan.

books.title: An Inquiry Into the Accordancy of War with the Principles of Christianity
books.author: Jonathan Dymond
books.summary: Dymond argues that war is incompatible with the teachings of Christianity.

books.title: On a Chinese Screen
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short vignettes about the people and places W. Somerset Maugham encountered during his travels along the Yangtze River in 1919–20.
